@bb love this thread how to vs friendly 4 teh sac

Still slower than this, and this weighs 38 tons!

http://i.imgur.com/deZFwOS.png

Thats not a boat at all. That things a plane. Or an "Ekranoplane"

This is a PT Speedboat that is designed to overtake other boats and sink them. Also why has no one created a torpedo yet?

I've managed to make one that is "semi-reliable"

I want to see a U-boat.
*cough*

thanks BrightBritches, the end of the week is good for me too.

Awesome boats, everyone. It's interesting to think about the different challenges posed by water. All the submarines I've ever seen in KSP use jets or rockets to thrust down and keep them under. But if you could build a craft that naturally sank it would be basically indestructable since any missile would be destroyed trying to get to it, or too slow to deal damage. I've only ever built one boat, a long time ago when I was playing around with the Kethane mod I made an oil tanker. Had a top speed of about 4 m/s but could hold almost a quarter million Kethane. That was before I discovered that Kethane drills only work on land.
Anyone else up for Korean War Replicas?
Hey, my grandpa was a colonel in that war! In the south korean military. (Apparently refused a promotion to general. I still wonder why.)

Oh yea, I forgot your last name If it makes you feel better People assume I'm from the UK because of my Full name.

Scott Edward Bowyer, Extremely British
I'm actually from the US, specifically my city of san diego. (Miramar airshow. Heck yeah.) My family is otherwise Korean.

I respect my British Heritage more than usual, Explains why I love Naval games and Ships.

Sbowyer Funfact: I love the Meteor, Vampire, Typhoon, Tempest and Spitfire MK-24

Hehe, same here. My favourite British 'thing' would have to be HMS Victory. She's absolutely beautiful.

HMS Dreadnought, The most revolutionary battleship of the 20th century, it set the standard for all ships at the time!!!

New spooky?

No, I started helping Mareczex333 with his request list, That's a Sabre. I do have a new Spooky though but I'm waiting for the new Arcadia thread.

Edited June 3, 2014 by The Fleet Master

She was beautiful too. It's sad to think that Victory was built in a dying age, when sail was about to become obsolete and steam would take over. At least the grand old warship wasn't scrapped. Unfortunately, the same cannot be said for the equally beautiful ship that followed her into battle at Trafalgar.

I think I'm finally done with the F-86 Sabre!!!!

Now to the MiG-15

Shoot down some migs! Time to make mig alley!

Ah, the good old days.

My foxhound replica from a while ago. Well, pretty accurate with looks due to the use of mostly stock parts. I could probably modernize it from scratch if it is needed in stock configuration.

Anyone remember my stealth drones? I wonder what that bay is for?

Edited June 3, 2014 by andrew123

For my first battle I thought I would go all out.

For space there will be three vessels, with a total mass of no more than 250 tonnes.

For sea there will be three vessels, with a total mass of no more than 200 tonnes.

For land there will be two vehicles, with a total mass of no more than 100 tonnes.

One vessel from each area can make a move per turn.

Sea and land units can engage each other.

If you don't want all three, just tell me which areas you to battle in.

Hyper edit is needed for the land and sea battle.

cords for sea battle {180, 180}

cords for land battle {181, 181}

persistent

Edited June 4, 2014 by iamonfire
hyper edit cords
I'll do the sea battle first, then the space battle, after that i will build some land vehicles and take the fight to the ground.
I'll send in two of my 'Royal Fortune' class ships for the sea battle, together they weigh in at #160 tons. I'll also send in an ekranoplan.

My move.

HMS Royal Fortune fires two guided missiles at Project H44, unfortunately they miss.

She then fires her forward-most gun, however this does little damage, but when she fires her second gun H44 seemed to tip over extremely quickly resulting in the loss of most vital instruments.

Persist:

http://www./download/7bv6j8fb55riov4/persistent.sfs

My move.

Nearest frigate moves to intercept HMS Royal Fortune.

She fires two short range HE missiles, one misses the other has no effect.

She then fires a medium range HEAP missile. It destroys the crew module on the HMS Royal Fortune, but both ships ended several hundred meters in the air and are destroyed upon landing.

We each have one ship left.

Your move.

persistent

Edited June 4, 2014 by iamonfire
